fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA. I am using customer data https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-35690
2. Login as arrowsmithn and I added "assigned to me"
3. In configuration user has selected 10-15 columns. 

Result:
1. JIRA is unable to handle the scenario.Please see the attached snapshot.

Expected:
1. The handling should be better here. Till 3.13.5 we don't give user option to select their columns but in JIRA 4.0 user can customize it but the scenario like these should be handle better.
fields.summary: Gadgets are not handling a situation where user has selected more number of fields in configuration then it can fit horizontally

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA. I am using customer data https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-35690
2. Login as arrowsmithn and I added "assigned to me" gadget to the dashboard.
3. In configuration I have selected column as "Affected version".

Result:
1. Please see the attached snapshot.

Expected:
1. The handling should be better here. Till 3.13.5 we don't give user option to select their columns but in JIRA 4.0 user can customize it but the scenario like these should be handle better.
fields.summary: In "Assigned to me" gadget configuration JIRA show blank data screen with multi page options for column selection no valid for user.

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Add Pie chart gadget on your dashboard.
3. Configure it with filter. Suppose the filter currently returns 0 issues

Result:
1. In 4.0 we show a big blank square/rectangle box depending upon column layout with message "no data available" in middle, which is quite annoying from user point of you.
2. Snapshots from both 4.0 and 3.13.5 is attached.

Expected:
1. Pie chart should n't take so much screen space if nothing is there to show
fields.summary: Pie chart gadget show a big empty box with message "no data available" if there is no data to show

fields.description:
Searching for the statement: _I'm sorry dave, I can't do that!_ via Quick Search or Text Search->Query causes JQL parsing to fail because of the exclamation mark:

h5.Basic 
!http://img.skitch.com/20090904-gssc7mb7bggu7ass9236fywf2d.jpg! 

h5.Advanced
!http://img.skitch.com/20090904-j2hef8yqsiquct47sxixymfs4x.jpg!

h5.Sans exclamation mark
!http://img.skitch.com/20090904-xykurnr4ixuw1y13x8myqurf9f.jpg!

h5.Against 3.13
Looks like this is not a regression from 3.13
!http://img.skitch.com/20090904-ff8yydduaw325fw6ntpmfdu3rf.jpg!
fields.summary: Exclamation marks cause parsing to fail for summary, description and comments via JQL

fields.description: We need to see all the issues for the filter once it is selected while linking.  Currently it only shows 50 issues.
fields.summary: Need the functionality to show more than 50 (all issues) for the filter while linking

fields.description:
* With RC4 the 'view all issues' filter link was moved to a non-obvious place.
* The refresh option also was removed from all gadget, this was very useful.
fields.summary: filter results opensocial gadget

fields.description:
Within subversion, I forgot into a commit log the Jira issue key. I changed the commit log to add the good Jira issue key.

Unfortunately, the change don't take effect into Jira, le commit log isn't inserted into the issue.

I see into JRA-15155 :
{quote}I am relatively confident that the fix for this is for you to shutdown your JIRA instance, remove the plugins/atlassian-subversion-revisions sub-directory of your indexing directory, then re-start JIRA. JIRA will re-index all your Subversion commit information on re-start.{quote}

But can you update the subversion commit log in this case without administrator intervention and without restart Jira.
fields.summary: Change in Subversion Commit Log Doesn't Update in Changed Issue

fields.description:
JIRA exposes a dialog web resource:
<web-resource key="dialog" i18n-name-key="admin.web.resources.plugin.atlassian-dialog.name"
                  name="dialog" state='enabled'>

This clashes with the dialog.css provided by AUI, which is a bundled plugin of JIRA and can cause issues like: JRA-18841.

I suggest to remove the dialog webresource to avoid problems like JRA-18841. We probably should check if we still use somewhere the old dialog web resource.
fields.summary: Remove dialog webresource from JIRA

fields.description:
We have the following Field Config Scheme for Monkey:

 Bug -> Shows Fix Version
 Other -> Hide Fix Version

When we view issue MKY-1 we expect the Fix Version to be displayed, but it is hidden.
fields.summary: Field Visibility for Fix Version not working correctly with issue type scheme (probably for all fields)
First Impressions - When setting up a first project, select the only name you can put

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-18853].
  {panel}

Currently when a first time admin has setup an empty JIRA he goes thought three steps.

Step 3 says "well done..now login" and gives a login link.

Why dont we allow him to login right there and then "with the user name" they gave us in step 2.

It would be a bit easier and make a better "first impression".
fields.summary: First Impressions - Setup step 3 improvement.  Allow them to login then and there

fields.description:
Steps:
1.Upgraded the JIRA 4.0 with customer data at https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-39999
2. Login as "dtc2660".
3. Goto Jana's dashboard.

Result:
1. All the gadgets in the left column.
2. If you login to 3.13.5 for same user with same data, the portlet "Show saved filter" is in right column.
3. Easy workaround is there for this issue.

Expected:
1. Upgrade should retain the position of upgraded portlets
fields.summary: Portlets present in right columns after upgrade shift to left column in 2 column layout in specific case

fields.description:
On the Browse Project, Browse Fix For Version, Browse Components pages there are a few problems:

# The statistics on the first row have a smaller offset from the right than the statistics on the second row
# The distance between icons and text for the component statistics is smaller than the distance of other stats (assignee, fix for version, status)
fields.summary: Vertical alignment on issues tab on the browse project/fix for version/component is off

fields.description:
The ModuleDescriptorHack is in a package used by atlassian-plugins, meaning that when the Host app packages are exported, this package wont have a version assigned to it.

This means I can't ugprade atlassian template renderer because it limits the versions com.atlassian.plugins to >2.2 & < 3.0.

Mark has a fix in plugins that he will implement.
fields.summary: ModuleDescriptorHack causes issues with OSGi package versions

fields.description:
If a filter returns more than 200 issues and I request an Excel export, the generated Excel actually only contains 200 entries.  Worse, the Excel report says at the top that it has the full range:

bq. Displaying 2017 issues as at 03/Sep/09 09:29 PM


At the very least, the text should say "Displaying 200 of 2017 issues".  Ideally the limit should be made known to users when they are about to click the link, and there should be a documented way to override it if necessary.
fields.summary: Excel view silently limited to 200 issues, with incorrect summary text

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA
2. In the Dashboard add "Issue Statistics" gadget.
3. The configuration dialog says select project/filter.
4. Press space to see all entries for project.

Result:
1. It only display options with heading Filters. 
2. User doesn't have option to select projects.
3. If you start typing project name, then it display project in list.

Expected:
1. Project names should be there in list
fields.summary: Gadgets preferences only show filters by default for selection.

fields.description:
Steps:
1.Upgraded the JIRA 4.0 with customer data at https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-39999
2. Login as "dtc2410".
3. On the user's dashboard there is a Issue Statistics gadget.

Result:
1. The value of all bar graphs for all issues with different status is not 100%
2. See the values in 3.13.5. Attached snapshots

Expected:
1. The value for bar graphs should be correct.
fields.summary: Issue statistics gadget values in bar graph doesn't add upto 100% for this upgraded data

fields.description: Web condition classes aren't autowired by Spring correctly for OSGi plugins.  The code that turns the condition class name into a class still uses Pico to lookup and instantiate the class, regardless of where it came from.  The code should be switched to the usual technique of checking if the Plugin implements AutowireCapablePlugin and delegating to it if true.
fields.summary: Web conditions aren't autowired from OSGi plugins

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-18844].
  {panel}

Steps:
1.Upgraded the JIRA 4.0 with customer data at https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-39999
2. Login as "dtc1824". The user is JIRA admin.
3. User has a favorite filter gadget on dashboard and click open to view "Current Iteration Report". The number of issues shown is 0 and in 3.13.5 is 13.
4. Click to view the actual query.

Result:
1. The query doesn't give user any error message but on clicking "Edit" takes user to advanced view(simple view is not allowed) with no error message. The query is "fixVersion = 10648 AND project = ATCWF ORDER BY key DESC". The issue here is that fixversion is hidden for this project.
2. I successfully reproduce this issue in JIRA 4.0.
3. Create 1 project with version 1, 2. Save a filter in simple view by selecting the project and fixVersion value.
4. Now the admin has make the fixversion field hidden for this project.
5. Execution of filter doesn't give error message as its a valid JQL query in JIRA 4.0 but for user upgrading to JIRA 4.0, it will unclear what is showing the different result, when filter is not showng any error message

Expected:
1. User should be notified of problem while viewing filter
fields.summary: JIRA doesn't show filter error if "fix version" is removed from field configuration for a project after filter is created.

fields.description: Going to http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/docs-040/How+do+I+unlock+my+JIRA+home+directory%3F actually takes you to http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/How+do+I+unlock+my+JIRA+home+directory? which displays a message about a missing page.
fields.summary: JIRA docs go to page that doesn't exist

fields.description:
The following features should be present on all issue (voted, watched, in progress, filter results, assigned to me):

* pagination
* column choice config with specific default columns 
* link to issue navigator (filter name or possibly total)
* total issues shown
* column headings
* sortability

|| Gadget ||Pagination || Column Choice || Default Columns || Issue Navigator Link || Total issues shown || Column Headings || Sortability||
| *Voted*| (/) | (x) | Type, Key, Summary, Priority, Status | (/) | (/) | (/) | (/)|
| *Watched*| (/) | (x) | Type, Key, Summary, Priority, Status | (/) | (/) | (/)| (/)|
| *In progress*| (/) | (/) | Type, Key, Summary, Priority | (/) | (/) | (/) | (/)|
| *Filter Results*| (/) | (/) | Type, Key, Summary, Priority | (/) | (/) | (/) | (/)|
| *Assigned To Me*| (/) | (/) | Type, Key, Summary, Priority | (/) | (/) | (/) | (/)|
fields.summary: audit all issue table gadgets for front-end feature consistency

fields.description: New version of the AUI plugin broke this I think.
fields.summary: Blanket not shown on chart popup

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-18839].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 13 Jan 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; however there are no immediate plans to put this suggestion on our near term roadmap.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Daniel Franz
dfranz@atlassian.com
Principal Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}
  

Hi,
I need to filter sub-tasks with certain values and the parent issue have a customfield to filter too.
Example:

parent=(cf[10000]="ParentValue1") AND cf[10001]="Subtaskvalue3"

where cf[10000] is a parent customfield and cf[10001] is a subtask customfiel.

Other dreamed example:

parent.cf[10000]="ParentValue1" AND subtask.cf[10001]="Subtaskvalue3"


Is possible? Thanks.
fields.summary: Create a JQL funcionality to filter the sub-task for a field value of the parent issue

fields.description:
FireBug makes web pages run slower.  The Dashboard is slow enought

FishEye puts up a message if it knows you are running FireBug

Google goes one step better and gives you a link to a page explaining how

{quote}
Firebug is known to make Gmail slow unless it is configured correctly. Fix this   Hide	
{quote}

http://mail.google.com/support/bin/answer.py?hl=en&ctx=mail&answer=77355

We should look into this.
fields.summary: Firebug makes JIRA slow - We should do what fisheye and Google does

fields.description:
If you look at the HTTP requests made by the dashboard, you can see http://jira.atlassian.com/styles/global.css getting requested multiple times in one page (once per gadget).

This file does change over time, but each version is cachable if requested by the correct URL eg http://jira.atlassian.com/s/443/2/78/_/styles/global.css
fields.summary: Gadgets are loading global.css under the non-cachable URL.

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Goto advanced view and type some search string.
3. Press enter or click "search" button.

Result:
1. The query returns result and focus is not anywhere.
2. If user is trying to create a perfect filter/query, it will quite frustrating experience to everytime bring focus back to the JQL dialog.
3. Please let me know if we loose something by changing the current behavior

Expected:
1. The cursor should stay in the search dialog after user has run the search.

Additional info:
1. YouTrack retains the cursor in the text search and seems good usability point
fields.summary: After submiting JQL form for searching queries doesn't retain the cursor in search dialog

fields.description:
Hi David,
We have noticed that if we create this issue via email and filling in the Original Estimate, this issue occurs.
Example, I had sent the following email to create an issue and I was able to reproduce 
From: Bagga, Rekha 
Sent: Wednesday, August 26, 2009 6:21 PM
To: jiramail
Subject: PHAAS 
project: ETP - Atlassian ALM
components:
summary: Test - please ignore
reporter: rbagga
assignee: rbagga
dueDate: 
dueDateFormat: dd-MMM-yyyy
priority: 2
issueType: Bug
watchers: rbagga
workEstimate: 8h
fixVersions: 
affectsVersions: 

So if the above email is sent, and an issue is created for the project mentioned from email
then we will see the issue where in the remaining estimate does not get filled in at all - says Not specified 
Please see attachment. 
What happens then is that when we log work against this issue, the automatic update of the remaining estimate is not occuring and as a result some metrics data are incorrect.
What needs to happen is, when an issue is created with an original estimate, the remaining estimate has to be equal to the original estimate 
Hope this makes sense
Thanks
Rekha
So if the above email is sent, and an issue is created for the project mentioned from email then we will see the issue where in the remaining estimate does not get filled in at all - says Not specified Please see attachment. What happens then is that when we log work against this issue, the automatic update of the remaining estimate is not occuring and as a result some metrics data are incorrect. What needs to happen is, when an issue is created with an original estimate, the remaining estimate has to be equal to the original estimate Hope this makes sense 
Thanks Rekha
fields.summary: Mail handler does not set the Remaining Estimate

fields.description:
Steps:
1.Upgraded the JIRA 4.0 with customer data at https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-39999
2. Login as "abrown". The user is JIRA admin.
3. Execute a JQL query "project = Tours and status = Open and RES-Deliverable = "Code - Layer 30"

Result:

fields.description:
I have a plugin which references a bundle JIRA cannot access for "some reason" and I got the following stack trace:
{noformat}
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] Stacktrace:
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServletWrapper.handleJspException(JspServletWrapper.java:505)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServletWrapper.service(JspServletWrapper.java:416)

[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:717)

[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] Caused by: java.util.MissingResourceException: Can't find bundle for base name templates.applinks.cruciblereviewlinkrendererhelp, locale en_AU
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at java.util.ResourceBundle.throwMissingResourceException(ResourceBundle.java:836)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at java.util.ResourceBundle.getBundleImpl(ResourceBundle.java:726)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at java.util.ResourceBundle.getBundle(ResourceBundle.java:699)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.jira.web.bean.I18nBean.getPluginBundles(I18nBean.java:410)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.jira.web.bean.I18nBean.<init>(I18nBean.java:88)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.jira.web.bean.I18nBean.<init>(I18nBean.java:109)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.jira.web.bean.I18nBean.<init>(I18nBean.java:99)

[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.jira.security.JiraAuthenticationContextImpl.getI18nHelper(JiraAuthenticationContextImpl.java:81)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.apache.jsp._500page_jsp._jspService(_500page_jsp.java:178)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.apache.jasper.runtime.HttpJspBase.service(HttpJspBase.java:70)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:717)

I believe this is reproducable by just having a declared i18n bundle in a plugin for which no properties file exists. I will be able to tell more once I get to the bottom of why it doesn't seem to work for me.

Here is the culprit for me right now:
{code:xml}
    <renderer-component-factory key="applinks.crucible.review"
                                name="Applinks Crucible Review Link Renderer Component Factory"
                                class="com.atlassian.jira.plugin.renderercomponent.SimpleRendererComponentFactory"
                                system="true">
        <order>209</order>
        <param name="rendererComponentClass">com.atlassian.applinks.core.renderer.crucible.CrucibleReviewLinkRendererComponent
        </param>
        <resource type="velocity" name="help" location="templates/applinks/cruciblereviewlinkrendererhelp.vm">
            <param name="help-section">links</param>
        </resource>
        <resource type="i18n" name="i18n" location="templates.applinks.cruciblereviewlinkrendererhelp"/>
    </renderer-component-factory>
{code}
fields.summary: Missing resource bundles in plugin are not catered for

fields.description: The same dashboard works in FF 3.5
fields.summary: Activity Stream gadget no longer working in beta4

fields.description: We only want this on oauth-required gadgets since anon-ok gadgets should fall back to use anon if unauthorised.
fields.summary: If a gadget requires oauth and the container is not authorised, a message should be displayed to the user to suggest an admin authorises the container

fields.description:
many gadgets require browse permission but not the project gadget since it must work in the situation where there are no projects and the simple browse permission check returns false since the number of permitted projects is zero. IN that case the projects gadget should be displayed and show a message to invite project creation (only if the user has project admin, otherwise suggests they contact the administrator to create a project).

But if the user is not logged in and the anonymous user does not have browse permission to at least one project (or project admin), in this case many project-centric gadgets cannot possibly show useful information and should probably not be shown.

This logic can be coded into the roles-required value. It should be named something like "PROJECT_ACCESS" or whatever. It fixes a number of awkward situations which are coded around in the project gadget for the common case where the user is not logged in and JIRA is configured private.
fields.summary: Fix comon permission case for project related gadgets (stops silly messages in projects gadget and friends)
The browse project page should respect Resolution field visibility when deciding what fragments to display.

fields.description:
We have a problem that we have dropdowns in iframes, different versions & other controls that all need to be hidden when clicking on the document. This does not happen in all cases for the following reasons.

- If you have a dropdown open then click a trigger to open another control, that event stops the propogation of the event. This means that the document never receives the "click" event and the active control is not hidden.  We have 3 *layer* controls in JIRA. They need to talk to each other.

- Iframes have a document element of their own. Clicking on the parent document or vice versa will not hide them.
fields.summary: Add layer manager to ensure dropdowns & other controls are hidden when clicking away in all cases.

fields.description:
A Bamboo Portlet (originally) saved some config data.  E.g planName and graphType.  As part of the move towards gadgets we changed this portlet to have no configuration properties and just display a message. 

However, JIRA can not handle this legacy data lying around:  

{code}
2009-09-03 11:23:31,990 http-8090-Processor9 ERROR admin 41011x146x1 1053x76 /rest/gadget/1.0/legacy/10044.json [server.impl.application.WebApplicationImpl] Internal server error
java.lang.RuntimeException: com.atlassian.configurable.ObjectConfigurationException: Field with key: graphType does not exist.
{code}

I am not sure whether it is up to us to remove the data from the portlet (via an upgrade task) or whether it is up to the legacy portlet handling to be slightly more forgiving and just ignore stored properties which are not longer needed.
fields.summary: Problems dealing with legacy portlet configuration

fields.description:
Chart view for Issue Navigator has no way of configuring gadget.

This happened when you moved the edit into the menu.
fields.summary: Chart view for Issue Navigator has no way of configuring gadget

There are for and asginst for this however!

fields.description:
On Windows I had a locked JIRA home and right got this page.

http://localhost:8080/JiraLockedError

I then removed the lock, started JIRa and then pressed refresh but the page then went

http://localhost:8080/JiraLockedError

{code}
HTTP Status 404 - NoOpServlet received an unexpected request. More information is available in the log file.

type Status report

message NoOpServlet received an unexpected request. More information is available in the log file.

description The requested resource (NoOpServlet received an unexpected request. More information is available in the log file.) is not available.
Apache Tomcat/5.5.26
{code}

Expected : it recovers from the no error state and redirects to home, like the other Johnson pages do!
fields.summary: JiraHome Locked page does not recover once error is gone

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Upgraded the JIRA 4.0 with customer data at https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-39999
2. Login as "bdolezsar".

Result:
1. On the dashboard for "Assigned to me " gadget the customer is having 13 gadget in 3.13.5 and 0 issues in 4.0.
2. The difference is in the field configuration for issues not shown, they have resolution field hidden in their field configuration. And in 3.13.5 we never care whether resolution field is there in issue or not. Now with JQL we care....
3. Currently the issues shown in 3.13.5 is also of now use as their status is closed. But if there are open issues for project having custom field configuration(with resolution hidden), then also they will not come in list

Expected:
1. The issues should shown in assigned to me list.
2. There will be very small portion of user who will have this kind of customization, that is not having resolution in field configuration. May be the best solution is to mention in documentation, what each gadget is looking while showing data and explain these edge scenario and let customer create their own filters.
3. Please let me know if any other scenario I am missing.
fields.summary: "Assigned to me" gadget will only return the issues having resolution field in their field configuration

fields.description: I commend Atlassian for providing the ability to create and publish a draft workflow while said workflow is currently active. Great improvement.  However, we need the same ability for creating common transitions.  I could make good use of common transitions, but choose to duplicate transitions instead so that I have the ability to edit them through the workflow editor.  It would be much nicer to be able to fully create, edit, and assign common transitions through the workflow editor.
fields.summary: Provide ability to create, assign, edit common transitions through the workflow editor.
Javascript error after logging in to JIRA

fields.description:
Currently, we have a lot of workflow actions that do not actually change the status of the issue.  We are using the method of selecting the current step as the destination step for the action.  For example, we have a transition called "Request an ES" that triggers a custom field value change, but leaves the issue in the "Accepted" state.  I have to select the "Accepted" state as the destination step, which is not a onerous task, but it has an unfortunate side effect:  since I need to issue a notification for this event, the notification lists the status as changed, but shows it as changed to the same status. This is confusing for the recipients of the notifications.  Here is an example:

Jason Developer updated TESTXIC-22:
-----------------------------------

    QA Blocker Review Requested: Yes
                         Status: Accepted  (was: Accepted)

I am aware that I can go into the XML and use "-1" as the unconditional result step, but I cannot do this through the workflow editor, which means I have to go through the horrible process of changing the workflow scheme for all of my projects so I can import the new workflow from XML.  Doing it this way also  has the same unfortunate side effect as the other method.
fields.summary: If the status has not changed during the transition do not show it as changed in notifications

fields.description: Until version 4.0, there was a nice border around the issue history information. In 4.0 it is missing, and it really looks odd. Can it please be restored? See attached screenshots.
fields.summary: Table borders are missing on view issue, affecting readability

fields.description:
I am using groups to define the members of default project roles.  Those project roles I then use in permission schemes for projects.  When I change the membership of one of these groups, any project role that has that group as a default group member should be updated.  However, for projects existing prior to that update, the changes are ineffective.  This is true whether the membership is augmented or reduced.  

Though I have not crawled the source code, I believe this is because the project role default groups appear to be parsed for their membership when a project is created, and the users in the default membership groups are added as *users per-project.  A more elegant solution would be to not parse the list and just assign the groups to the projects upon creation.  

I am able to work around this issue by adding the same groups to the project roles on a per-project basis.  However, the global assignment should apply and cascade group membership changes to project roles properly to mitigate necessity of this manual step.
fields.summary: Project Role default group members list does not dynamically update for pre-existing projects

fields.description:
Problem:

Project names are shown to users with no permission to see the project.

Impact:

Security hole!

Recipe:

(it helps to have two browsers open one logged in as admin the other as the user I will create called dummy)

* Add user dummy
* Add project blah
* Add custom field myuser of type user picker, global context and shown on all screens
* Remove all role assignments for project blah
* Grant yourself permission to create and edit issues in project blah
* Create issue BLAH-1
* Login as user dummy and check you cannot see project BLAH in BROWSE PROJECT -> All Projects (or BROWSE PROJECTS) (*{color:green}good{color}*)
* As the admin user edit project blah permission scheme
** Grant Browse Project permission to User Custom Field Value (myuser)
* Login as user dummy and notice that you can now see project BLAH in BROWSE PROJECT -> All Projects (or BROWSE PROJECTS) (*{color:red}bad!{color}*) but you cannot see issue BLAH-1 (*{color:green}good{color}*)
* As the admin user edit issue BLAH-1 and add user dummy to the myuser field
* As the dummy user you should now be able to see issue BLAH-1 (*{color:green}good{color}*)

The problem is that {{com.atlassian.jira.security.type.UserCF:hasProjectPermission()}} must return true for the user to see the issue even though {{com.atlassian.jira.security.type.UserCF:hasIssuePermission()}} exists to determine that. Making {{com.atlassian.jira.security.type.UserCF:hasProjectPermission()}} return false correctly stops the project appearing in the project list but also prevents the user viewing any issues.

I did a quick Google and checked for issues in this JIRA but couldn't find this bug.
fields.summary: "User Custom Field Value" permission type incorrectly exposes JIRA project names to everyone

fields.description:
To reproduce this problem:

   1. Create project A. Project key: PA.
   2. Create 3 issues in project A: PA-1, PA-2, PA-3
   3. Create project B. Project key: PB.
   4. Create 1 issue in project B: PB-1..
   5. Create project C. Project key: PC.
   6. Create 1 issue in project C: PC-1.
   7. Create a filter that include PB and PC. Save filter as TestFilter.
   8. TestFilter displays two issues: PB-1 and PC-1.
   9. Examine TestFilter in searchrquest table. It should have both PB and PC's project ids.
  10. Remove project PB.
  11. TestFilter now displays issues from PA and PC, representing all projects.
  12. The correct / expected behavior is that TestFilter should display 1 issue (PC-1) and not include 3 PA issues.
  13. Examine TestFilter in searchrquest table. It still has both PB and PC's project ids.

fields.description:
The admin sitemesh decorator calls {{final String message = reindexMessageManager.getMessage(remoteUser);}}. The problem with this is that it in turn calls {{ActionContext.getRequest().getContextPath()}}. If we're not coming through a web action however (which may be the case for the OAuth admin section for example: /plugins/servlet), then this blows up with a NPE.

Should use the VelocityRequestContextFactory instead.
fields.summary: Admin decorator doesn't work when decorating non-webaction requests

fields.description: please see the attached files
fields.summary: We are geting some error for upgrade from 3.13 to "4.0 Beta 3" can you please help

fields.description:
The webwork url taglib does not URL encode the path part of the URL.  It does encode the parameters if passed in via the param tags but it never does the path part.

So for example

{code}
<webwork:url page="/secure/admin/workflows/ViewWorkflowSteps.jspa">
                            <webwork:param name="'workflowName'"><webwork:property value="." /></webwork:param>
                            <webwork:param name="'workflowMode'" value="'live'"/>
                            </webwork:url>
{code}

in the above case the param parts will be url encoded but the  "/secure/admin/workflows/ViewWorkflowSteps.jspa" part is not.  If this happened to have non 7bit ascii in it then it would be invalid.

Also there is another argument about this tag should also HTML encoded.  The use case of this code is ALWAYS in the context of HTML output and hence the output as such should be sage to be plaved inside a href="" attribute.

While not essential for 4.0 ship, this is something we should fix.
fields.summary: webwork url tag does not url encode the the path part of an URL passed in

XML backup and restore is not a viable option, as we are having a 200K issues database.

Unless there is another way that we missed.
fields.summary: No way  upgrading to license2 in JIRA 4 when performing an in situ db upgrade?

fields.description:
Atlassian allows users of its products to:

* Watch entire spaces in Confluence, not just individual page.
* Watch entire projects in FishEye, not just individual changesets.

In JIRA, though, there's no way (without the use of RSS, which regrettably has not received as much penetration into the business user market as was once hoped) to watch a project for new/updated issues.

Would it be possible to add functionality to JIRA such that a user can just start watching a JIRA project as a whole?
fields.summary: Enable users to watch for updates to JIRA projects

fields.description:
For the Dutch JIRA, the author and creation time are not displayed when choosing Commentaren.  When choosing Geschiedenis Wijzigingen, the author and creation time are displayed.
Instead, it displays the java code (see screenshot).
Occurs on many windows, especially the ADMIN tab.

Also, word combinations should be written in ONE WORD in Dutch!  Spelling it in two words means something completely different (E.g. 'Melding Zoekmachine' means 'reporting the Navigator' instead of 'Issue Navigator') and is therefore confusing. (Common error these days under influence of the globalised English language and/or erroneous and incomplete translation dictionaries :()
Sorry though, Geschiedenis Wijzigingen is correct, it is the history of the changes and not the change of the history... ;-)
Other words that are spelled incorrectly:


||incorrect||correct||also correct||
|Dashboard Configuratie|Dashboardconfiguratie|Configuratie Dashboard|
|portal pagina |portaalpagina|| 
|Melding Zoekmachine|Meldingzoekmachine||
|Project Samenvatting |Projectsamenvatting|Samenvatting Project| 
|Melding Type|Meldingstype|Type Melding| 
|controlere |controleren|| 
|beinvloeden |beïnvloeden| | 
|Navigator kolommen |Navigatorkolommen|| 
|U heeft momenteel geen zoek of filter geselecteerd. |U heeft momenteel geen opzoeking of filter geselecteerd.|| 
|Gebruikers Samenvatting |Gebruikerssamenvatting|Samenvatting Gebruikers| 
|{color:red}Geschiedeniswijzigingen {color}|{color:green}Geschiedenis Wijzigingen{color}| {color:green}(Wijzigingengeschiedenis) {color}|
fields.summary: Author and date don't appear for comments in Dutch translation

fields.description:
When trying to register a Job that is volatile and non durable we get this message:

{panel}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Non durable jobs are currently not supported: JobDetail 'DEFAULT.GreenHopperIndexes':  jobClass: 'com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.customfields.GreenHopperRankingJob isStateful: false isVolatile: true isDurable: false requestsRecovers: false
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.OfBizJobStore.storeJob(OfBizJobStore.java:243)
	at org.quartz.core.QuartzScheduler.addJob(QuartzScheduler.java:650)
	at org.quartz.impl.StdScheduler.addJob(StdScheduler.java:244)
	at com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.configurations.GHConfiguration.registerService(GHConfiguration.java:367)
	at com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.configurations.GHConfiguration.toggleNightServiceOn(GHConfiguration.java:344)
	at com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.actions.GHConfigurationAction.doToggleNightService(GHConfigurationAction.java:108)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at webwork.util.InjectionUtils$DefaultInjectionImpl.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:61)

fields.summary: Cannot register a Job if this one is non durable
It would be good to list all the plugin points and the plugins that implement them

fields.description: For example when I am on the issue navigator, if I click on the administation dropdown, I have two tabs selected. Only the administration tab should be selected until I close the dropdown.
fields.summary: Header should only have a single "tab" selected

fields.description:
Please view the attached screenshot for details

Some other issues:
1. Inputting invalid value for user name, doesn't give error message.
2. : and required field indication should be done for all gadgets.
fields.summary: Some improvements for activity stream and other gadgets in JIRA

fields.description:
We are getting this in JAC:

{code}
2009-08-28 03:24:44,752 main ERROR     [com.atlassian.scheduler.OfBizJobStore] The Quartz Job class 'com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.customfields.GreenHopperRankingJob' cannot be loaded
2009-08-28 03:24:44,752 main ERROR     [com.atlassian.scheduler.OfBizJobStore] The Quartz Job configuration for 'GreenHopperIndexes' is invalid!  This can be caused by Plugin JARS no longer being available on the class path.
2009-08-28 03:24:44,752 main ERROR     [com.atlassian.scheduler.OfBizJobStore] A NoOp Job class has been returned and hence 'GreenHopperIndexes' will not do anything until fixed.
{code}

I think this is being caused by a durable JOB that is currently saved in JIRA. The durable JOB tries to load the job but can't find it because its in OSGI fairy land. 

We have told JC to start this JOB when the plugin starts rather than save it in the database. The solution in the end may be to delete this job from the database and let greenhopper register again each time JIRA starts.
fields.summary: Durable jobs do not seem to load correctly when the class comes from plugins2

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Add "Filter Results" gadget to the dashboard.
3. Configure the gadget by selecting a filter.

Result:
1. It show the filter name in the header of the gadget.
2. Try to access the filter by clicking on it, nothing happens.

Expected:
1. The filter name should be a link as in 3.13.5
fields.summary: Filter name in "Filter Result" gadget should be a link

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Add Favorite Filters gadget to the dashboard.
3. Suppose we have a filter for which 0 results are matching.

Result:
1. Currently we show the count as blank in gadget.
2. For similar scenario in 3.13.5 we used to show the count as 0

Expected:
1. The count should be shown 0 if no matching issue is there for filter.
fields.summary: Issue count is shown blank for filters having no matching issues in Favourite Filters gadget
Exclude Closed issues in Time Tracking Report

fields.description:
May be fixed in trunk but some keys seem to be missing
# gadget.filterstats.assignee.unassigned
# gadget.filterstats.fixfor.unscheduled
